intro: Romulea discifera, commonly known as the broad-leafed romulea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related plants. The plant produces striking, showy flowers with a distinctive yellow center and purple outer petals. Its bulbs are adapted for storing water and nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Romulea discifera thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
